data.title: Gambling and Food
data.text: Spent the Veteran's day weekend in Bossier city. Gambling at Margaretville was very good. Most of the machines I played did give more than I put in, of course you can't win on every spin. But the payouts are proportional. The restaurant was great!! Food was hot and very satisfying. Plan on returning in the near future.

data.title: Tight machines
data.text: Friendly staff, very bright cheerful place.  Nice décor.  Rooms were big, clean and very comfortable.  Easy parking or use valet.  Its a casino, many machines but very tight on return.  Seemed everyone we talked to had the same observation.

data.title: Party weekend
data.text:
8 of us stayed at hotel for weekend of eating and gambling.  The hotel was clean and well maintained.  The staff was friendly and helpful.
In the casino the dealers were helpful and mostly friendly.  Would stay here again.

data.title: Top cabin all the way
data.text:
Rooms are big and very well appointed with comfortable beds and bathrooms are well designed, highly functional and well appointed.
The view was very nice .I strongly recommend staying here and name is due to change to Wind Creek as soon as Gaming Commission approves sale and transfer.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text:
I was pleasantly surprised, because I was expecting a smoky smelling room because of the smoking in the casino. I can prepared with a can of Lemon Lysol, but did not need. The room was non smoking, clean, stylish, comfortable bed. NO complaints from me. I wanted to stay here last year, but the rate was higher than
 I wanted to pay. Was passing thru Bossier City and found a Thursday night special offer and booked immediately. Looking forward to another stay at this location soon for the "Right Price".  Check In was a breeze with friendly customer assistance.

data.title: Nice adult getaway
data.text: We used a comp invite to stay over night  on Wed night.  The room was nice and clean. We slept good after staying up late at the casino.  The slots seemed to be playing with us Wed nite.  We ate at the Seafood Buffet and it was good.  However, we ate late and some of the seafood was cooling off.  I recommend going to the buffet earlier in the night when they are busy and putting out fresh food constantly.  They did have a good selection.  It is pricey since it has so much seafood so use your comps and points to give you a bargain.

data.title: one night getaway
data.text: We finally got a comp'd room at Margaritaville. The rooms were nicer than a lot in Bossier but it is one of the newest also. The room was clean. The A/C seemed to be doing what it wanted to do though. The pillows were nice pillows however too large. I'd like to seen a choice like at some other hotels have the nice huge fluffy pillows and then the smaller more slender ones.

data.title: Check your bill before you leave
data.text:
Great place to stay in Bossier as it is a newer casino.  Stayed there as we went to see a concert. First time there and had heard nothing but good things about it from our family who have stayed there on overnight trips to the area.   Went to sleep after the concert and around 2 am the tv next door was loud which continued till around 5:30. Couldn't stand it anymore so my husband went to the front desk and reported it. They were very prompt and called the next room who shut it off (I think they were an elderly couple who couldn't sleep and hear too well and so had the tv blaring out loud).  The reason is the room had a connecting door which is not sealed tight to seal off the noise. The front desk lady on her own said that they would give us a 15% discount on our room. We were in a hurry to check out and sure enough the discount wasn't on the bill.  The morning front desk person said it wasn't entered in the computer!!  
Lesson learned--1) check your bill before you leave; If you are getting a discount reiterate to the clerk to make sure it is entered to reflect on the bill;
2) if you need a good nights sleep do not get a room with a connecting door unless you ask for it.  There is no filter to block the noise.
Great place otherwise.

data.title: My new favorite casino hotel on the Red River!
data.text:
The hotel is clean, attractive, well-run, and the casino is as well.  This is the first casino I've ever been in that has Bev Express.  If you're playing a slot machine, you simply order your drink from a screen at your seat, and the cocktail waitress appears with your drink in minutes.  We were using it on a Wednesday night, so on a weekend or busy time it might not work as well.

The hotel has some nice restaurants, and there are several others a short walk away on The Boardwalk.

data.title: Awesome Hotel on The River
data.text: Enjoyed every minute of my stay. My fiance and I were supposed to stay 2 days. Ended up staying a third because I loved it so much. Room was bright and smelled very fresh! Definitely had a beach feel. The pool was awesome and very quiet and peaceful in the morning. Poolside bar had the best straw margaritas! Conveniently located on the river with nice walking trail. We enjoyed watching the sunset over the river. We didn't spend much time in the casino. We spent more time at the Riverwalk, bar & pool! I will be back and I hope that it's just as nice the 2nd time around!

data.title: Great one night getaway
data.text: The nicest casino hotel room! Quiet nice people in hotel. Great beds you can get lost in the sheets. Shower was really big. This was our first time staying there and we will be going back for another stay.

data.title: One rude staff member ruined my visit
data.text: The check in staff were friendly and professional. The guy at the casino security was a rude and horrible employee and they should be ashamed that he is being paid a wage.  After arriving after 30 minutes I thought I'd go downstairs to gamble. I'm on holiday so I don't have a handbag, only a backpack to carry my purse and medication.  He first asked to look in the backpack. As I went to open it he changed his mind and said I couldn't go in with it.   How is it different to a handbag?   I was happy to show the contents.  He made me feel like a criminal.   Shame on you.

data.title: Clean Friendly and Fun
data.text:
The hotel and grounds - Very clean, bright and fresh. Although they allow smoking I didn't notice it like some of the Indian Casinos I've been too. Felt safe everywhere in walking around the outside of casino late  at night.
Casino - Fun, no tight, was able to play all night without breaking the bank, the drink service sucked for a Sunday night, tried the xpress drink service 3 times and never got my drinks, one lady stopped by and asked if I ordered a beer i said yes and never seen her again, service was a little better at the table
Room - we had a king on the 12th floor and it was spotless, bed was perfect, lots of pillows and AC kept us nice and cool, plenty of channels on the TV, not sure about wifi didn't need it. Only knock IMO is the reusable shampoo and soap dispensers sorry not going to use something somebody could have messed with. Get rid of those it's gross
Staff - Everyone was friendly and helpful, 
Food - We ate at Margaritaville and the burger and fries were excellent, no wait and fairly cheap. ate at the buffet in the morning at the pretty good selection, a little steep IMO on the price for breakfast but manageable

Long story short - I'd rather drive the 3 hours from Mckinney Tx then the 1 hour to Winstar. I had a great time nd can't wait to go back

data.title: Just a quick stop
data.text: Room was comfy and quiet.  Not a lot of outside noise disturbing my sleep (important to me)! LOL Bed was comfortable and the a/c worked VERY well.  I loved dinner at Jimmy's - I especially enjoyed their fall special dinner for two including a bottle of wine.  Food was very good and a nice surprise in a casino!  I stayed on a Thursday, so checking in was quick and easy - no lines and the valet was quick and easy both arriving and departing.  I must say every employee I dealt with was super friendly and helpful. Only visited the casino itself for a short time, I broke even so was good not to walk away with a loss!  I will definitely stay here again!

data.title: Great Rooms for Non-gambling travelers
data.text: We are not gamblers, but often you can get a very nice room for a good price at casinos.  This place provided just that.  We stayed twice in the last month for one night each while on a roadtrip.  Beautiful rooms.  The first room had wrap-around windows on a corner and a wrap-around balcony.  You could see two bends of the Red River from the room.  Clean, elegant, 2 free sodas and 2 free waters in the refrigerator upon arrival.  There are some restaurants on the property as well as several placed to eat and good shopping within a block.  Lovely walk along the Red River.  We will definitely stay here again as we travel through.

data.title: Good Sunday Buffet
data.text: My wife and I stopped there for lunch today, Sunday, 10/9/2016, and we were both very pleased with the service and the good selection of different foods to choose from. There is no way that a person can leave there hungry. Seafoods, beef, pork ribs, gumbos, salads, breakfast foods, eggs to order, desserts. Foods too numerous to name all of them and a wide selection of beverages that come with the meal.

data.title: Loved It!
data.text: Me and my Bestie stayed here for a weekend getaway. This hotel is awesome.. The view from the 19th floor was beautiful. We enjoyed the hot tub with an outdoor bar.  The staff is so friendly and helpful from the valet, to the helpdesk to the ladies  that keep the rooms clean. They also have a lockbox/safe in the room for added security. I will definitely visit this hotel again.

data.title: Great experience
data.text: Was told when we booked they have a $100 hold beyond room charge ,could put on credit card or pay cash,refunded next day.Joked at least sure to leave with $100.Front desk service good,rooms we comfortable and immaculate.Slots we good went out with more than went in ,which is good ,but can't retire.Ate at the epic buffet for supper on Tuesday,husband was happy with all you could eat crablegs and beer.The waitresses that clear dishes and bring you your drinks were probably the most impersonable of our whole 10 day vacation,this also was experienced for breakfast.Overall experience was great,wish I was closer to go back.

data.title: Awesome Hotel!
data.text: This was our first time staying at the Margaritaville Resort Casino Hotel. I have never had a hotel experience like this one. The room was beautiful, the amenities great, the bed was so very comfortable. My husband and I said that we were definitely booking again, again and again as long as it stays like this or gets better!

data.title: Showing wear and tear
data.text:
We aren't the pickiest travelers so we were able to have a good time here. If you don't pay close attention to details (or if you keep a few drinks in you) you can have a decent stay here. 
The parking is good. The area is great- right on the river and a very short walk to a pretty, outdoor shopping center. We went here three times during our stay and even ate there twice instead of in the hotel like we'd planned on. 
The place is just showing too much wear and tear. Furniture is chipped and stained. The sheets on our bed had multiple holes in them. The margaritas were some of the worst we've ever had. The Margaritaville restaurant which looks so cute and theme-y on their website is actually in shambles. The food tasted like oil, the service was slow.
The waitresses in the casino were friendly though. And yes, we experienced what many other reviewers have written- tight slots. 
We thought the spa was great- nice atmosphere and decent prices for great service. The pool area is pretty, but was very dirty. Cushions stained, spiderwebs and bugs on chairs. We got in the hot tub and after a few minutes the foamy layer on top disappeared and we saw that the sides of the hot tub were caked in dirt and leaves and there were limes and a straw floating in the water. 
Overall, we had a good time, but I think that's due more to our glass-half-full attitudes. Next time we're staying at Horseshoe.
